result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffaney M. Mercier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffaney M. Mercier

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SBDA= $75.00 came in after the sentencing on this date

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Tiffaney M. Mercier, appeared with Attorney John T. Stichert.  Agreement reached, Defendant pled guilty to the charge and was assessed $100.00 plus costs including a DNA surcharge of $200.00 and Service fee of $60.00. Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month beginning 12-20-2015
by State

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Tiffaney M. Mercier, appeared with Attorney John T. Stichert.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference at 07-30-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 07-30-2015 09:30 am

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Signature bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State; Defendant, Tiffaney M. Mercier, did not appear.  A body only bench warrant was requested and granted on the defendants failure to appear.
Adjourned initial appearance at 06-18-2015 09:20 am

The defendant shall have no contact with H.P.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the Clark County Sheriff Department   to complete the booking process with the Clark County Jail, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Tiffaney M. Mercier appeared, pro se, Court orders defendant to be finger printing and photographed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 09:20
